required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Placebo-Controlled Study of Oral Ozanimod as Maintenance Therapy for Moderately to Severely Active Crohn's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study of Oral Ozanimod as Maintenance Therapy for Moderately to Severely Active Crohn's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 3, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to demonstrate the effect of oral ozanimod as maintenance therapy in subjects with moderately to severely active Crohn's Disease.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with a CDAI score of < 150
primary_outcome.description: The Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) is a composite score that is used to measure the clinical activity of CD.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with a Simple Endoscopic Score for Crohn's Disease (SESCD) score decrease from baseline of ≥ 50%
primary_outcome.description: The SES-CD assesses the degree of endoscopic inflammation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with average daily abdominal pain score ≤ 1 point and average daily stool frequency ≤ 3 points with abdominal pain and stool frequency no worse than baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Abdominal pain scores and stool frequency scores are patient reported outcomes collected from the patient diary

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with CDAI reduction from baseline of ≥ 100 points or CDAI score of < 150
secondary_outcome.description: The Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) is a composite score that is used to measure the clinical activity of CD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with a CDAI score < 150 at Week 52, while remaining corticosteroid-free in the prior 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) is a composite score that is used to measure the clinical activity of CD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with a CDAI score of < 150 in subjects with a CDAI score < 150 at pre-randomization
secondary_outcome.description: The Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) is a composite score that is used to measure the clinical activity of CD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with a CDAI score of < 150 at Week 52 and at ≥ 80% of visits between Week 8 and Week 52, inclusive, in subjects with a CDAI score <150 at pre-randomization
secondary_outcome.description: The Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) is a composite score that is used to measure the clinical activity of CD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with absence of ulcers ≥ 0.5 cm with no segment with any ulcerated surface ≥10%
secondary_outcome.description: Ulcer size will be measured during endoscopy, and assesses the degree of endoscopic inflammation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Histologic improvement based on differences between ozanimod and placebo in histologic disease activity scores (ie, Global Histologic Disease Activity Score [GHAS] changes (Geboes, 2000))
secondary_outcome.description: Global Histologic Disease Activity score is a measure of histologic inflammation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with average daily abdominal pain score ≤ 1 point, and average daily stool frequency score ≤ 3 points with abdominal pain and stool frequency no worse than baseline and an SES-CD decrease from baseline of ≥ 50%
secondary_outcome.description: Abdominal pain scores and stool frequency scores are patient reported outcomes collected from the patient diary. The SES-CD assesses the degree of endoscopic inflammation

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with CDAI score of < 150 and SES-CD decrease from baseline of ≥ 50%
secondary_outcome.description: The Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) is a composite score that is used to measure the clinical activity of CD and the SES-CD assesses the degree of endoscopic inflammation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with average daily abdominal pain score ≤ 1 point, and average daily stool frequency score ≤ 3 points with abdominal pain and stool frequency no worse than baseline and an SES-CD ≤ 4 points and a SES-CD decrease ≥2 points
secondary_outcome.description: Abdominal pain scores and stool frequency scores are patient reported outcomes collected from the patient diary. The SES-CD assesses the degree of endoscopic inflammation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with CDAI reduction from baseline of ≥ 100 points or CDAI score < 150 and SES-CD decrease from baseline of ≥ 50%
secondary_outcome.description: The Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) is a composite score that is used to measure the clinical activity of CD and the SES-CD assesses the degree of endoscopic inflammation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with CDAI score < 150 at Week 12 and SES-CD decrease from baseline of ≥ 50%
secondary_outcome.description: The Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) is a composite score that is used to measure the clinical activity of CD and the SES-CD assesses the degree of endoscopic inflammation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with CDAI reduction from baseline of ≥ 70 points
secondary_outcome.description: The Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) is a composite score that is used to measure the clinical activity of CD and the SES-CD assesses the degree of endoscopic inflammation

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with mucosal healing (SES-CD ≤ 4 points and a SES-CD decrease ≥ 2 points) and histologic improvement by GHAS or Robarts Histologic Index (RHI)
secondary_outcome.description: Global Histologic Disease Activity score is a measure of histologic inflammation

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to relapse and exclusion of other causes of an increase in disease activity unrelated to underlying CD (eg, infections, change in medication)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to relapse is defined as an increase in the CDAI score from Maintenance Day 1 of ≥ 100 points and a CDAI score > 220, SES-CD score ≥ 6 [or ≥ 4 if isolated ileal disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with a Crohn's Disease Endoscopic Index of Severity (CDEIS) decrease from baseline of ≥ 50%
secondary_outcome.description: The CDEIS assesses the degree of endoscopic inflammation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of adolescent subjects with Pediatric Crohn's Disease Activity Index (PCDAI) ≤ 10 points
secondary_outcome.description: The PCDAI is an instrument that was developed and validated for numerical assessment of disease activity in children and adolescents with CD (Hyams, 1991). The PCDAI includes subjective patient historical information, physical examination findings, objective laboratory parameters, data on weight gain/loss, and height velocity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of adolescent subjects with decrease from baseline in PCDAI score ≥15 points
secondary_outcome.description: The PCDAI is an instrument that was developed and validated for numerical assessment of disease activity in children and adolescents with CD (Hyams, 1991). The PCDAI includes subjective patient historical information, physical examination findings, objective laboratory parameters, data on weight gain/loss, and height velocity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline (Induction) in Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire (IBDQ) scores (adult subjects only)
secondary_outcome.description: The IBDQ is a self-administered, 32-item questionnaire concerning 4 dimensions of quality of life (Hlavaty, 2006).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline (Induction) in 36-Item Short Form-36 Survey (SF-36) scores (adult subjects only)
secondary_outcome.description: The medical outcomes SF-36 questionnaire provides a measure of the subject's health status. The SF-36 consists of either scaled scores, which are the weighted sums of the questions in their section.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline (Induction) in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment questionnaire for Crohn's disease (WPAI-CD) scores (adult subjects only)
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI-CD (Reilly, 1993) is a validated, reliable and responsive instrument that assesses the impact of CD on work and activity during the past 7 days (Reilly, 2008).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline (Induction) in EuroQol 5 dimensions questionnaire (EQ-5D) scores
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D (The EuroQol Group, 1990) is a validated, 6-item, self-administered instrument designed to measure generic health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) scores (adult subjects only)
secondary_outcome.description: The PGIC scale evaluates all aspects of patient's health and assesses if there has been an improvement or decline in clinical status. The self-report measure PGIC reflects a patient's belief about the efficacy of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in CD-related hospitalizations, procedures, and surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Healthcare resource utilization will be evaluated in this study to assess the impact of CD and health-related outcomes (hospitalizations, emergency department or urgent care clinic visits, procedures, and physician visits).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of circulating lymphocyte concentration
secondary_outcome.description: T and B cell panels consisting of Treg cells, naïve T and B cells, memory cells and plasmablasts are evaluated for assessment of immune status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of gene expression
secondary_outcome.description: Interferon signature are assessed in the blood and in colon biopsies to evaluate differences based on disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of protein biomarker concentration
secondary_outcome.description: Protein biomarkers such as high-density lipoprotein, C-reactive protein, fecal calprotectin, Immunoglobulin A (IgA) are measured in addition to assessing clinical endpoints to help evaluate disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of pharmacogenetics
secondary_outcome.description: Markers such as Interferon Regulatory Factor 5 are evaluated to better understand genetic variations that could lead to differences in response to Ozanimod.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of impact of SARS-CoV-2 serologic status on subjects receiving ozanimod and CD
secondary_outcome.description: SARS-CoV-2 serology (anti-SARS-CoV-2 total or IgG) from serum samples are measured to support advancing the understanding of the impact of SARS-CoV-2 on ozanimod and Crohn's disease. It may also be used to support health authority requests for analysis and advancement of pharmacodiagnostic development to better target drugs to the right patients

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive a single 0.92 mg capsule [equivalent to ozanimod HCl 1 mg] once daily x 52 weeks
Subjects will receive placebo capsule orally once daily x 52 weeks
Subjects will receive a single 0.46 mg capsule [equivalent to ozanimod HCl .5 mg] once daily x 52 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Subjects must satisfy the following criteria to be enrolled in the study:
1. Subject fulfilled the inclusion criteria at time of entry into the Induction Study (RPC01-3201 or RPC01-3202) and have completed the Week 12 efficacy assessments of the Induction Study.
2. Subject is in clinical response (a reduction from baseline in Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) of ≥ 100 points or CDAI score of < 150 points) and/or clinical remission (CDAI score of < 150 points) and/or has an average daily stool frequency score ≤ 3 and an average abdominal pain score ≤ 1 with abdominal pain and stool frequency no worse than baseline at Week 12 of the Induction Study.
Exclusion Criteria:
The presence of any of the following will exclude a subject from enrollment:
Exclusions Related to General Health:
1. Subject has undergone a colectomy (partial or total), small bowel resection, or an ostomy (ie, temporary colostomy, permanent colostomy, ileostomy, or other enterostomy) since Day 1 of the Induction Studies or has developed symptomatic fistula (enterocutaneous or entero-enteral).
Exclusions Related to Medications:
2. Subject has received any of the following therapies during the Induction Study:
a. rectal steroid therapy (ie, steroids administered to the rectum or sigmoid via foam or enema) b. post-baseline initiation of, or increase in, corticosteroids to treat worsening CD to a dose greater than the maximum daily dose taken between the screening and baseline visits c. rectal 5-ASA (ie, 5-ASA steroids administered to the rectum) d. parenteral corticosteroids e. total parenteral nutrition therapy f. antibiotics for the treatment of CD g. immunomodulatory agents (6-MP, azathioprine, including but not limited to cyclosporine, mycophenolate mofetil, tacrolimus, and sirolimus) h. immunomodulatory biologic agents as well as other treatments for CD such asetrasimod, filgotinib, and upadacitinib I. investigational agents j. apheresis
